medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began 24 hours prior to admission, characterized by nausea and vomiting (emesis x4). The epigastric pain started the same day and radiated to the back. The patient reports having pain numerous times before and has longstanding cholelithiasis.
medical_history.past_medical_history: AFib on Coumadin, HTN, HLD, Stage 3 CKD with baseline creatinine of 1.3-1.4, diverticulosis with diverticulitis, superficial thrombophlebitis, lumbar back pain, constipation, anemia, lumbar spinal stenosis, morbid obesity, cholelithiasis, thyroid nodule, hyperthyroidism.
